pull_request.title: DebugTools: Simplify the symbol map
pull_request.body:
### Description of Changes
Simplified the symbol map :chart_with_upwards_trend: 
IOP module export support :star: 
IOP module tree :deciduous_tree: 
Breakpoint enable column was moved to the start :rewind: 
Fixed an issue where you could CTD when trying to do something with an empty function list :skull: 
Allowed a user to stub from an opcode, instead of forcing a function to be there :anger: 
Used the proper sorting role for the thread list proxy model :1234: 

Supports unloading modules when ReleaseLibraryEntries is called. :cloud: 
Supports proper module version management. :book: 

Resetting the IOP will cause all loaded modules to reset. User added functions will be untouched **unless you've added one on a modules export entry address** :recycle: 

### Rationale behind Changes
Improved quality of the debugger :100: 

### Suggested Testing Steps
Mess around with the IOP tree view and make sure it makes sense :brain:

issue.title: Meta: GSdx top left corner issue
issue.body:
I'm trying to implement a solution to handle properly the top left corner post-processing effect. Let's centralize information here.

Game impacted (from the top of my head, likely more).
- [x] MGS 2
- [x] Prince of Persia
- [x] Urban Chaos
- [x] killzone
- [x] destroy all humans
- [x] Star wars battle front 1
- [x] star war battle front 2
- [x] horsez
- [x] JamesBondEverythingOrNothing
- [x] DeathByDegreesTekkenNinaWilliams
- [x] Catwoman
- [x] Mercenaries (unfortunately suffer of half screen bug)
- [ ] Summoner
- [ ] Stolen
- [ ] Hitman: Contracts
- [ ] Midnight Club 2 #2708 

Better but still broken
- [x] MGS3 (codec might suffer from another tc issue)
- [x] GSC_TouristTrophy (better but still has a couple of issue)
- [x] kung fu panda (remain plenty of other effects)

Broken due to bad detection of the effect
- [ ] GSC_Manhunt2 => (will need dedicated CRC shader) #2758
- [x] Tekken5 => dedicated shader must be good now
- [ ] Ridge Racer V #1327
- [ ] Ratchet & Clank #914
- [ ] Ghost in the shell #1327 
- [ ] GT4 (better but still has a couple of issue) #1313 
- [ ] Steambot Chronicles #2722
- [x] TalesOfAbyss => dedicated shader must be good now

Need test:
- [ ] GSC_BlackHawkDown (night filter)
- [ ] GSC_ZettaiZetsumeiToshi2
- [ ] tales of legendia

comment.body:
This problem is also present on Peter Jackson's King Kong, can be observed during the opening lifeboat scene with hardware rendering.
also something like this happens in the angry monkey effect, transparent squares but all over the screen.

with software rendering it doesn't do this.

issue.title: CI/Linux: Disable Wayland and spring cleaning
issue.body:
### Description of Changes

Disables Wayland, it's super broken/buggy in basically every scenario. KDE isn't _too_ buggy, GNOME is a complete disaster.

 - Stupid obsession with CSD in Gnome => inconsistency
 - Inability to position windows => window position saving doesn't work, log window attaching (not merged yet) doesn't work
 - Hacks in render-to-main because WL craps itself otherwise
 - Despite said hacks, game list still glitches after stopping emulation, happens more often in gnome
 - NVIDIA just crashes in swap chain creation under Wayland
 - Broken global menus
 - and many others

Until they sort their s**t out, which is unlikely, since there's been very little progress over the last decade, just keep it disabled. For the Flatpaks, users can re-enable it with flatseal if they really want the crappy experience.

Bumps the Flatpak to the KDE/Qt 6.6 runtime, now that it's available.

Bumps the compiler to Clang/LLVM 17, as that's all that's available in 6.6

Removes the host:ro filesystem permission from the PCSX2 flatpak. It's not needed, since we go through portals for adding game directories, and gets rid of the big ass warning about filesystem access on flathub.

NOTE: If you're using third party launchers/frontends with the flatpak, this **will** break them, since they're probably not using portal paths. Go complain to your launcher/frontend about it, **not us**, there are ways they can work around it (but I'm not going to do their job for them, since a good number of them are scummy paid products).

### Rationale behind Changes

See above.

### Suggested Testing Steps

Make sure AppImage and Flatpak still work.

comment.body:
> A warning for GNOME users to use XCB? 

Users don't read warnings. They just complain that it's broken.

> Default to XCB but allow wlroots users to use Wayland? 

Not possible, because the decision gets made by Qt before our code runs in the first place. Unless we put a shell script in place, but then self builds versus release builds have behaviour differences, which I'd very much like to avoid.

> I get why this choice was made but it does hurt users who would prefer a prebuilt binary that supports Wayland, even if via some random config or whatever... Good luck trying to build PCSX2 on my computer 

That's what's happening, at least with the flatpak. As far as I'm aware, flatseal can add additional arguments, so you can override QT_QPA_PLATFORM and add --share=wayland. The code for Wayland is still in the binary, so it'll "just work".

AppImage had to have the libs removed because I didn't want to mess around with a custom AppRun script, and as I said above, it'd take precedence over anything user supplied anyway.

comment.body:
My bad I didn't see that,

A warning for GNOME users to use XCB? Default to XCB but allow wlroots users to use Wayland? I get why this choice was made but it does hurt users who would prefer a prebuilt binary that supports Wayland, even if via some random config or whatever... Good luck trying to build PCSX2 on my computer 😃

comment.body:
> Have you considered not supporting GNOME? wlroots is the only good wayland library, if more popular applications only support wlroots then GNOME and KDE will effectively be forced to adopt wlroots instead of their own crap code.

Did you read my last post? I specifically addressed this:

> And don't give me the "but I don't use GNOME, I use wlroots/kwin/whatever, it works fine", that's good for you, then build from source, or use the flatpak+flatseal. Unfortunately, a good chunk, if not a majority of Linux users end up with GNOME, and they get the crap experience, and we can't really say "if GNOME, disable WL", since Qt makes that decision, not us.

commits.message: DebugInterface: Fix r3000 isValidAddress
MipsStackWalk: clang-format
MipsStackWalk: Fix IOP stack walking
MipsStackWalk: Detect leaf functions.

Debugger: Humanise CSV exporting

An oversight of the old system was that all integers were converted to hexadecimal
Debugger: Add spacebar as a breakpoint toggle hotkey
Debugger: Provide visual feedback of a breakpoints enable setting
Debugger: Try to rationally size bp,tl and sf columns
Debugger: Fallback to unmangled symbol when it cannot be demangled
Debugger: Visually show what CPU triggered a breakpoint
Debugger: Disable instruction simplification

GS/HW: Minor optimization on color dest blend.

Add early return, no need to run the rest of the code.
Qt: Update Base Translation

issue.title: [BUG]: Shadow Tower Abyss - Possible Interlacing-related issues (Regression?)
issue.body:
### Describe the Bug

Shadow Tower Abyss appears to run de-interlaced on stable PCSX2, but has massive interlacing artifacts with dev PCSX2.

For some reason when running this game on stable PCSX2 (v1.6), the game visually appears to run in 480p. There is no screen-shake or interlacing artifacts of any kind when running the game with Auto and None de-interlacing.
![gsdx_20221108221211](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53349573/200987993-215816fc-dbdd-4c11-a78c-b60c65ff959e.png)

However with the dev builds of PCSX2, the game appears to run interlaced. Strangely though, there isn't any screen-shaking of any kind when setting it to None like most interlaced games do, but there are massive interlacing artifacts present when moving the camera around in any way.
![Shadow Tower Abyss_SLPS-25217_20221108220955](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53349573/200988505-f36dd458-8e70-47e8-8951-445924cb4b27.png)

Here's an example video to describe what I'm talking about. 

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53349573/200990715-af64e9a2-5ba4-421e-8623-abcb94b13dd6.mp4

I'm not the best at describing things, so I can gladly try and clarify any of this if asked. 
I apologize in advance for making a thread over what is probably an inconsequential issue, but the game looks way better on stable than dev so I figured I'd make a post about it.





### Reproduction Steps

Start new game
Look around

### Expected Behavior

_No response_

### PCSX2 Revision

v1.7.3547

### Operating System

Windows 10 (64bit)

### If Linux - Specify Distro

_No response_

### CPU

i5-7600k

### GPU

GTX 1050ti

### GS Settings

De-interlacing on None and Bilinear Filtering on Off to showcase the bug more clearly, but these options aren't required to see the bug.

### Emulation Settings

All cheats disabled, ran on fresh installs of both v1.6 and v1.7.3457 builds.

### GS Window Screenshots

_No response_

### Logs & Dumps

Multi-frame GSdump
https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/675471889501519922/1040101945077157908/Shadow_Tower_Abyss_SLPS-25217_20221109211041.gs.xz

comment.body: no problem lol, yeah I think you can change anything you like.

comment.body:
MAD deinterlacing did not help with this issue, however using @refractionpcsx2's KF4 scanmask blur removal patch, I made one for STA and it works great. I'll add this to the patch repo since the KF4 one is in there, posting it here for any random people that stumble across this thread.

[Remove Scanmask Blur]
author=val
description=Disables scanmask usage to reduce blur when turning.
patch=1,EE,20158CA8,extended,24050004

https://github.com/PCSX2/pcsx2/assets/53349573/4fa97c07-9870-4895-9ad0-548efce42ac4

commits.message: DebugTools: Simplify the symbol map

Debugger: IOP Function Tree

Co-authored-by: Ziemas <ziemas@ziemas.se>
Debugger: Prevent crashing opportunities when there is an empty function list
Debugger: Stub the current opcode if no function is selected
Debugger: Flip the `Enabled` breakpoint column
Debugger: Use the proper data role for sorting threads

issue.title: CI/Linux: Disable Wayland and spring cleaning
issue.body:
### Description of Changes

Disables Wayland, it's super broken/buggy in basically every scenario. KDE isn't _too_ buggy, GNOME is a complete disaster.

 - Stupid obsession with CSD in Gnome => inconsistency
 - Inability to position windows => window position saving doesn't work, log window attaching (not merged yet) doesn't work
 - Hacks in render-to-main because WL craps itself otherwise
 - Despite said hacks, game list still glitches after stopping emulation, happens more often in gnome
 - NVIDIA just crashes in swap chain creation under Wayland
 - Broken global menus
 - and many others

Until they sort their s**t out, which is unlikely, since there's been very little progress over the last decade, just keep it disabled. For the Flatpaks, users can re-enable it with flatseal if they really want the crappy experience.

Bumps the Flatpak to the KDE/Qt 6.6 runtime, now that it's available.

Bumps the compiler to Clang/LLVM 17, as that's all that's available in 6.6

Removes the host:ro filesystem permission from the PCSX2 flatpak. It's not needed, since we go through portals for adding game directories, and gets rid of the big ass warning about filesystem access on flathub.

NOTE: If you're using third party launchers/frontends with the flatpak, this **will** break them, since they're probably not using portal paths. Go complain to your launcher/frontend about it, **not us**, there are ways they can work around it (but I'm not going to do their job for them, since a good number of them are scummy paid products).

### Rationale behind Changes

See above.

### Suggested Testing Steps

Make sure AppImage and Flatpak still work.

comment.body:
Software developers when they actually have to maintain their software:

> We're sick of getting blamed for bugs in wayland compositors, while the various committees sit around arguing with each other, finally decide on standard ways of doing things after half a decade, then GNOME ruins it all by refusing to implement it.

Have you considered not supporting GNOME? wlroots is the only good wayland library, if more popular applications only support wlroots then GNOME and KDE will effectively be forced to adopt wlroots instead of their own crap code.

release.name: v1.7.5157
release.short_description_html: • GS/HW: Minor optimization on color dest blend.

commits.message: Debugger: Flip the `Enabled` breakpoint column
Debugger: Prevent crashing opportunities when there is an empty function list
Debugger: Stub the current opcode if no function is selected

GS/HW: Minor optimization on color dest blend.

Add early return, no need to run the rest of the code.
